entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency exchange Huobi is laying off 20% of its employees, according to multiple reports over the past two days. However, Huobiâ€™s advisor Justin Sun, the founder of Tron, told the South China Morning Post that the layoff reports were untrue. A Huobi spokesperson later confirmed that the staff cuts are true and Huobi plans to maintain â€œa very lean teamâ€ going forward.
Huobiâ€™s Justin Sun Denies Layoffs Amid Controversy and Alleged Employee Protests

entry.summary:
In the latest update, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), former CEO of a bankrupt crypto exchange FTX, requests the court to block debtorsâ€™ access to his Robinhood shares. A report announced by US prosecutors revealed the Robinhood shares are worth $450 million.
SBF has been under house arrest since his apprehension by the Royal Bahamas Police Force after the U.S. filed criminal charges against him. All these took place in December 2022, weeks after the crash of his crypto exchange, leaving many with multiple losses.
Department of Justice Set To Seize SBFâ€™s Robinhood Shares

entry.title: Mutant Ape Planet NFT Creator Aurelien Michel Arrested at JFK Airport
entry.summary:
Aurelien Michel, a French national residing in the United Arab Emirates (UAE), was arrested on Wednesday evening and charged with defrauding investors in his Mutant Ape Planet NFTs, of $2.9 million.

A criminal complaint unsealed in a US federal court on Thursday revealed the 24-year-old was arrested a day prior by US government authorities at JFK International Airport.

Michel capitalized on the broader ape-themed NFT early last year by offering 9,999 images of mutant apes. The NFTs were sold on the Ethereum

entry.title: Justin Sun Confirms Huobi Staff Layoffs As Insolvency Rumors Swell
entry.summary:
TRON founder Justin Sun, rumored to be the shadow owner of Huobi Global, has confirmed that the crypto exchange was laying off a significant amount of its workforce. This comes amid several rumors circulating in the crypto community, all of which end with the conclusion that Huobi is reportedly insolvent.
Sun Confirms Layoff Rumors
Over the last couple of days, there have been rumors circulating on the social media platform Twitter that Huobi was laying off staff. It had started when there had been rumors that the exchange was asking employees to take their salary payments in stablecoins such as USDC or risk being fired.
Then in the last day, tweets surfaced online that the crypto exchange had shut down its communication channels for employees. One tweet which carried screenshots sâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: XMR Hits 2-Month High, ADA Extends Recent Gains
entry.summary:
Monero slipped from an earlier two-month high, as December U.S. nonfarm payrolls (NFP) showed signs of a slowing labor market. Figures released today showed that the NFP fell to 223,000, down from a reading of 263,000 the month prior. Cardano was mostly higher, as it rose to a multi-week high.
Monero (XMR)
Monero (XMR) surged to a two-month high of $158.11 earlier in todayâ€™s session, which came prior to the release of Decemberâ€™s U.S. nonfarm payrolls report.
However, following the report, which showed that 223,000 jobs were added to the U.S. economy, the token fell to a low of $151.90.
Initially the surge in price came as XMR broke out of a resistance level at $155.00, however as of writing, it is once again below this point.
Looking at the chart, XMR/USD also moved lower as thâ€¦

entry.summary: For Bitcoin, 2022 was a year of lessons, frustrations, vindications, progress and, in some cases, regress. What should we take with us for 2023? This is an opinion editorial by Aleks Svetski, author of â€œThe UnCommunist Manifesto,â€ founder of The Bitcoin Times and Host of the â€œWake Up Podcast with Svetski.â€ It is part four of his â€œRemnant Series.â€ What a year. Many of us said that it would only get stranger, but Iâ€™m not sure anyone was truly ready for what would transpire. In this short article, Iâ€™m going to have a quick look at the good, the bad and the ugly of 2022, and Iâ€™ll talk a little about what decisions Iâ€™m making for 2023 onwards. Iâ€™ve been controversial at the best of times, to say the least, and perhaps unnecessarily toxic at the worst. Iâ€™ve decided that this needs to change becaâ€¦

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Highlight Reel
entry.summary: In December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, Decrypt Studios held the inaugural Crypties awards gala. With emcee Josh Ostrovsky ("The Fat Jewish") and presenters from a range of crypto projects, statuettes were awarded in nine categories. The evening was sponsored by Polygon, Filecoin Foundation, Lamina1, Async, BeetsDAO, The Gold Mask, Gem Set, Breakout, Anonymous, Infinite Objects, Ape Water, Decentralized Pictures, and Vault 721.

entry.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation
entry.summary: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch Episode 27 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.

entry.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto
entry.summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agencyâ€™s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Donâ€™t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SECâ€™s thinking on cryptoâ€”straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. entry.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit
entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.
